title: Gian Paul Ramirez
subtitle: THE CURIOUS CODEWRIGHT
aboutMe: Curiosity killed the cat... good thing I’m not a cat. I was the kid mashing buttons on an unplugged PS2 controller, wondering how that little black box made the magic on screen. That curiosity pulled me into computer science and software engineering, where games became my gateway to building real things. In industry, I interned at Amazon bringing Alexa to wearable devices and learned how to ship reliable, user-friendly features. In school, I built projects that kept the spirit of play alive, from a Unity tactics RPG to a Steam recommendation engine, and I designed and maintain this site. I earned my B.S. in Computer Science at UCF and I’m finishing my M.S., building software that feels like magic, this time with the controller plugged in.

projects.title: Groundbreak
projects.description: What if the arena itself were your arsenal? Groundbreak is a roguelike tactics RPG where you sling element-infused tiles to create reactions; sandstorms, smoke, fireballs and more will help you outsmart a multi-floor dungeon of creepy-crawlies. On a four person team, I led combat design and implementation: tile-flinging, the elemental reaction system, and enemy AI powered by A* pathfinding. My favorite part was iterating with 10+ playtesters, tuning each element so multiple viable build paths emerged, keeping every choice fun. (RIP Sandstorm)
